name: Avoid orphaned synonyms in PL/SQL context
description:
This metric identifies synonyms that are defined on objects which no longer exist. This is syntactically possible.
Indeed through a series of CREATE synonym statements, a synonym could be defined and in fact refer to itself
output:
This report lists all synonyms that are defined on objects which no longer exist. It provides the following information:

the  list of each synonym that match the citerion. The name of each synonym that is part of  the  full name,
rationale: Presence of synonyms that are based on non existent object will generate error at execution time when accessed. Even if synonyms is authorized at creation time, the execution time will generate error
remediation: Aplly clean up in your code
total: Number of synonyms that is part of the analyzed source code
alternativeName: Avoid orphaned synonyms in PL/SQL context
